question.title: How to open a specific Flutter screen from background using Android BroadcastReceiver (e.g., when power is connected)?
question.body:
We're building a Flutter app that should automatically open a specific screen (e.g., AlarmScreen) when the device is plugged into power (ACTION_POWER_CONNECTED), even if:

  • The app is closed (killed),
  • The app is in the background,
  • Or the screen is off/locked.

We implemented a native Android BroadcastReceiver that checks a flag (state.txt = 1), and launches the app with:

launch.putExtra("openAlarm", true);
launch.addFlags(Intent.FLAG_ACTIVITY_NEW_TASK);
context.startActivity(launch);
In Flutter’s MainActivity, we call:

setShowWhenLocked(true);
setTurnScreenOn(true);
We pass the openAlarm flag using MethodChannel in onNewIntent().

In Flutter (Dart):

On app startup, we call platform.invokeMethod("checkIntent") and navigate to AlarmScreen if true.

We also handle MethodChannel.setMethodCallHandler to catch "onNewIntent".

We expected:

That AlarmScreen would always open when openAlarm=true is received via intent — even if the app was backgrounded or killed.

What actually happens:

If the app is already running → everything works.

If the app is in background or was killed → MainActivity receives the correct intent, but AlarmScreen does not open.

Logs confirm the intent arrives with openAlarm=true, and MethodChannel is called.

We believe Flutter is not yet "ready" to push a screen at that moment.
